definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: He had ignored warnings from his civil servants about his friendship with Mr Werritty.
sentences.chinese: 他忘記提醒手下的公務人員他與威瑞特的關係。

sentences.english: We are civil servants of the Communications Bureau of Hanzhong.
sentences.chinese: 我們是漢中市交通局的公務人員。

sentences.english: He is assiduously shedding civil servants and wants to fix the procurement process to avoid exorbitant cost overruns.
sentences.chinese: 他努力裁減公務人員並要在軍事採購中避免非法超支。

sentences.english: Instead, the plan sees civil servants replacing many private contractors.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨計劃用一些公務人員代替許多個體承包人。

sentences.english: She has been, and continues to be, a devoted public servant.
sentences.chinese: 自始至終，她都是一名勤於奉獻的公務人員。

sentences.english: We've found that civil servants are often too busy to see us.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現，公務人員往往在我們看來過於忙碌”。

sentences.english: Students who participate in public exams or license exams and have the exam permit can apply for leave for official duty.
sentences.chinese: 參加公務人員考試或檢定考試，而持有準考證者。

definition: to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
